text: CREDITS ROLL OVER ‘GIRL ON THE STREET’ INTERVIEWS done on a cheap video camera in various locations around Chagrin Falls, Ohio (population 6,500, an hour south of Cleveland): A TEEN GIRL #1 speaks into the camera, playing with her hair as she tries not to giggle.

Mostly, girls just hook up with guys at parties, but usually it’s with someone they know, like a friend. I mean, it’s not like I hear people saying I’m saving myself for marriage or anything. She giggles and we cut to a TEEN GIRL #2, this one scrunching her face into her turtleneck, to hide her identity. Her friends mill in the background.
The point of being young is to experience a bunch of people so you know what you want. In a few more years I’1l be able to tell a good one from a bad one.

(yelling out) And the big ones from the little ones. Another teen laughs, revealing her face and we cut to a TEEN GIRL #3 who has her hair cropped close. She speaks directly at the camera, dangerously close to the lens.
They’re nasty sluts. And slutty girls become slutty women and then they marry nasty guys, who drive gross cars and smell like cheap beer. A TEEN GIRL #4 pushes the Teen Girl #3 aside and screams:
Is this like those Girls Gone Wild? Are you from MTV?

head_text.subj: SHE RAISES HER SHIRT AND FLASHES HER BREASTS, SCREAMING

text: TEEN GIRL #4 (CONT’D)
The screen freezes. The title  11/4/05 2. Normal Adolescent Behavior Appears over her breasts.

MUSIC: Gary Glitter sings his raunchy “Do You Wanna Touch Me” Late Summer in Chagrin Falls, Ohio about forty minutes south of Cleveland. WENDY BERGMAN (senior, 17, beautiful but not ready to accept it) walks through the “Coop” private school grounds; she leads us under banners that say “WELCOME NEW CLASS” and “DON’T DIS THE ORIENTATION -- HAVE FUN AND WELCOME!” It all feels like it could be the Summer of Love except for the girls are wearing Seven jeans and the guys are wearing vintage and everyone’s hair is done, even the ‘alternative’ kids. Wendy passes by as a group of fifty students does a ‘lap sit’ -- they stand in a circle and then sit down at the same time. Eventually they fall amid general hysterical laughter. If Wendy wasn’t rolling her eyes before, she certainly is now. ACROSS THE QUAD we meet BILLIE (17, short blond hair and vintage clothes, hottest girl in school according to current web polls). She is walking towards Wendy; she is blond to Wendy’s brunette, intelligent enthusiasm to Wendy’s brilliant sarcasm. They are a perfect match for each other. A car pulls up quickly between them as they near the parking lot. It squeals to a stop and SEAN MAYER (17, tall with good looks that skew slightly pretty) gets out of the car. The car squeals away. If it looks like the opening of the Breakfast Club, well, all the better. He skulks towards the orientation festivities but he also steals a glance at Wendy. Billie yells out to Wendy:

Woman! Wendy jogs the last few feet to her best friend and then they join the rest of the group. Besides Billie there is ANN, Chinese with a defiant red streak in her hair; JONAH a stoner reading a Miles Davis biography;  11/4/05 3. ROBERT, tall and the most conventionally good looking of the unconventional group and PRICE who has blond hair and blue eyes and wants desperately to fit in. Which is why he pulls out, and places on his head, a TRUCKER’S CAP. The GROUP GROANS.
What?
You should burn that hat.
It’s plastic. Toxic fumes?
He could burn a little of it Symbolically. She jumps up, fishing a lighter from her bag. She hands the hat and the lighter to Price.
Do it. Show us you’re better than the hat. The group looks at Wendy, asking for permission.

Burn a little. It’1ll be good for you. Price burns a little of the hat, sheepishly, and the group all cheer. Price leans over to hug the girls and it quickly turns into a wrestling/play fight. Wendy looks up and sees a FRESHMEN GIRL and guy whispering and looking at the group’s antics. Wendy stands up, brushing herself off. WENDY (CONT’D) Sorry.
(to the Freshmen) Can we help you? The rest of the group get up as well, looking slightly sheepish, except for Billie. The Freshmen stand there, waiting.
What?!  11/4/05 4. Freshmen Girl points to Wendy’s necklace, which reads “Hoochie”.
I like your necklace. The two laugh and walk away. Wendy touches her necklace, stung.
Okay! I think we’ve successfully oriented ourselves. Billie? Billie stands up, and the group gathers their things.
(to Wendy) Are you leaving?
(motioning out to the field) Can’t. My brother’s here.
(to Wendy) You okay?
Yep.
Call me later?
Frigging right. All six hug, with real warmth. Somebody yells out to them from a passing car.
Kiss. Kiss. Kiss! Wendy and Billie roll their eyes.
Seriously, when did being a lesbian become cooler than blowing a rock star?
You’ve never blown a rock star.
Neither have you.  11/4/05 5. They laugh. The other four are a little ways away, but Billie hangs on to Wendy for a second.
What if you could blow a rock star?
And ruin what we have? Billie slaps Wendy’s ass.

That’s my girl. Wendy waves at Billie as she joins the others and walks off. Wendy is all alone outside the school. She wanders around, kicking a few pebbles, she picks a leaf froma tree and starts humming the theme to “The A-Team.” Wendy goes back inside the school.

The school is empty, a little eerie. Still humming, Wendy heads towards the classrooms, which are all ina large hangar type building -- each classroom is divided with partitions into a “bay”. In the center is a library and at the far corner, a SCIENCE classroom.

Inside the science area, Wendy opens a door removing ETHANOL. Pouring the ethanol into a wide-mouthed beaker she places the leaf in the ethanol, lights a Bunsen burner and lets the leaf start to boil in the solution. Sean watches, unseen by Wendy.
Blowing up the school? Wendy tries to act cool.
Did you follow me in here?
I wanted to get the lay of the land. Plus I hate that song.  11/4/05 6. Sean hums the “A-Team” theme back. Wendy is caught for a second, then comes right back at him.
The “lay of the land”.
I’m new. I figured I could, I dunno, memorize where everything was.
There’s not much to memorize. She turns him around and points out the “landmarks” of school.
These are the classrooms. No walls, so you have to have respect for everyone. That’s a big word around here -- respect. Make sure you use it inappropriately.
Like irony.
That would be “incorrectly.” Wendy points out some more places in the school.
That’s the library. We gather in the lounge for announcements every Thursday for Community Meeting; better known as “where people bitch about the lack of respect in the public bathrooms”.
You’re not blowing anything up, are you? Wendy turns back to her leaf.

Get the lights. She gestures to the other side of the room. Sean runs to the switch, hits it. The sun has started to set, so the room is relatively dark. Wendy turns the Bunsen burner off. The leaf GLOWS BRIGHT RED.  11/4/05 7. WENDY (CONT’D) I just read about it and I wanted to try it. The electrons in the leaf are ‘excited’. They have these names that are so... Human. Excited. Lazy. Aggressive. Did you know they can be “impure”?
You couldn’t try it during school?
I hate chemistry.
But She puts her finger to her lips.
Shhh.
(smiles) Your secret’s safe. I swear.
Who would you tell? He’s stung, but hides it.
My mom’s a chemist. I would never make fun of you for liking this stuff.
(indignant, he’s hit close to home ) If you did I’d kick your ass.
If I did it would be ironic.
That’s incorrect.
Kicking my ass would be inappropriate.
No, but it would be disrespectful.  11/4/05 8. A pause as she looks at Sean. He smiles at her. She tries not to smile back but she does.

Wendy! The lights blaze on, and the leaf stops shining red. Sean and Wendy move apart, quickly. At the other end of the room is NATHAN BERGMAN (15, he recently grew about six inches, now he’s a taller version of his gawky old self).
My brother, Nathan.
Can we go home already? Wendy dumps out the ethanol and leaf, and walks away from Sean, who quickly follows her.

Wendy’s car pulls into a driveway, on the left, a large Tudor house, on the right, a similarly sized brick home with a much less well-tended yard. INT. WENDY’S CAR - DAY Sean sits in the passenger seat, Nathan’s in the backseat.
(points left) This is me.
(points right) That’s me.
I know.
You know?
Have you read “The Watchmen”?
You knew who I was?  11/4/05 9. Sean keeps his eyes on Wendy.
Yeah. I mean, I saw you, you know, around. I didn’t know who you were.
So you read it? Because I have all of them. If you wanna, you know, read them or whatever.
Yeah, I’1l read them.
I’m going in, okay?
You could come over...ask my mom about impure electrodes or whatever.
I’m good. Thanks.
(super eager) Or you could come over to our house tomorrow? You can read them then.
Yeah, sure. Nathan grins, thrilled. Wendy watches Sean as he gets out and goes into his house. Nathan is already at their front door.
You have the keys! Wendy sighs and gets out of the car.
Why’d you ask him over for Saturday?

Why not? Wendy doesn’t answer. FADE TO BLACK. LEGEND: This Is Saturday  10 14 12 13 11/4/05 10. INT. JONAH’S HOUSE: ROOM - DAY 7 Zippy, happy pop music plays as we see our group get ready for Saturday night in their own homes on a Saturday afternoon. Jonah fixes his hair, takes a long pull on a bong, refixes his hair and then puts on a Cleveland Indians baseball hat. INT. ANN’S HOUSE: ROOM - DAY 8 Ann sits on her bed, which is surrounded by posters that have inspirational sayings, like “Hang In There, Baby,” and “God Will Provide, But It Helps To Study”. Ann brushes her hair, tries out pigtails, then a ponytail, then scrunches it around so it covers her face. INT. PRICE’S HOUSE: ROOM - DAY 9 Price reads a copy of RAYGUN while he is lifting weights. INT. BILLIE’S HOUSE: ROOM - DAY 10 Billie applies lip liner, fills it in and then blots. She does it again. And again. INT. ROBERT’S HOUSE: BATHROOM - DAY 11 Robert showers, singing loudly along to the pop song we hear. INT. BERGMAN HOUSE: WENDY’S BATHROOM - DAY 12 And finally Wendy, who is in her bathroom, sitting in the tub though there is no water in it, as she absentmindedly drums her fingers. INT. BERGMAN HOUSE: NATHAN’S ROOM - EVENING 13 Nathan sits poised in his room, when the doorbell rings and he springs to life and runs out  14 15 11/4/05 11.
Nathan sprints down the stairs and runs to answer it. Downstairs, Sean is waiting for Nathan.
Hey.
Hi! (trying to be cool) Hey.
(he holds the comics up) I brought these. If you want to read them.
Great. Cool.
So thanks for inviting me.
We’re neighbors.
Nathan has carefully prepared a tray of food, which is waiting for them. A pause.
Holy shit. My mom can barely make pop tarts.
Oh I made it.
For me?
Yeah, I mean, I don’t get many guys, I mean people, you know...
Yeah. No. That’s cool.  16 11/4/05 12. Sean takes an involuntary step back.

No... I mean, I like to cook, so it isn’t like. I mean, like I didn’t plan everything, it’s not a trap. Here. Look, see these, these are really easy to make - - Nathan grabs a cookie off the tray and hands it to Sean but as he does, he trips on his own feet, he tumbles towards Sean and his hand ENDS UP ON SEAN’S CROTCH. There is a moment where Nathan doesn’t know what to do. His hand actually stays there he’s so confused. Sean moves away and Nathan stands up and does what anyone would do; he runs out. Sean goes after him. INT. BERGMAN’S HOUSE: WENDY’S ROOM - NIGHT 16 The girls are hanging out, talking about Sean.
He’s from Chicago.
So he transferred as a senior?
I guess. People transfer.
In third grade people transferred. We’ve had the same people in our classes forever.
So?
He seems a little too Queer Eye and not enough Straight Guy.
(a little too quickly) He’s not. He’s nice.
He was nice to Nathan.
Your brother is easy to be nice to. Like puppy dogs and homeless people.
Billie!
I’m not the one making him out like Sean the Saint.
(the peacekeeper ) If we were normal girls, we’d be fighting over him. Fresh meat.
Thank god we’re not normal. Wendy goes to the door.
I’m getting a pop.
For me too.
Yeah. Wendy shuts the door.
Wendy is getting three Diet Cokes from the fridge.
Dammit.
Wendy walks toward the voice, seeing Sean in the back foyer, standing in front of an open garbage can. He has an apple core, which he can’t throw away because the garbage is overflowing.
Yeah. I was supposed to take that out.  19 11/4/05 14.
Hey. Wendy takes glances quickly above her, as if Billie and Ann could see her right now. But they can’t, so:
I’1l get it. Wendy takes the garbage bag out of the garbage and ties it shut.
You need help?
Sure. He takes the bag and follows her to the backyard.

They walk to the six trashcans that line up on the property line between their houses. Sean’s backyard is littered with boxes. Wendy opens a trashcan and Sean places the bag inside. As he does, his hand touches hers for a moment, and she catches his eye.
You were sweet to come by.
Nathan’s weird. But potentially very cool.
He’s temporarily weird. Proof that phases are real. Wendy absently wipes her hand on her pants.
Is your hand okay?
Huh? Yeah. You know when you touch something gross? Sean looks down at his own hand.  11/4/05 15.
(laughs) Oh god, no -- not you. I’m sorry. I meant the garbage.
Oh. A pause.
I should go in. They don’t move, just stand there for another moment.
You’re kinda weird, too.
Amazing line. Brilliant.
And how do you know it’s a line? He steps closer to her, thinking about kissing her
Well, if you’re calling me weird in earnest, that’s pretty mean.
(quiet) So you’re hopeful I’m trying to pick you up.
Pick me up? What are you from, 1976?
You’re funny.
No I’m not.
Yeah. Clever. Funny. Smart. You like science.
Those are all words that mean ugly.  20 21 22 11/4/05 16.
You are definitely not ugly. You’re just pretty and smart. Wendy has nothing to say to this. They move closer to each other so that they are almost kissing, but they don’t touch.
I can’t-- I mean, I’m not...
Okay.

(not moving) I’m not available. If you didn’t find that out at orientation, you’1l definitely find it out soon. From in front of the houses the sound of a horn honking interrupts them; Sean and Wendy stay still for one moment longer, but then Sean realizes who it is.
I’m sorry. Sean leaves Wendy standing there. She waits until he is gone and then sprints inside.

Wendy grabs the three Diet Cokes, frantic, almost dropping them. She runs upstairs. INT. BERGMAN HOUSE: WENDY’S ROOM - NIGHT 21 Billie and Ann are looking out the window at the car; Wendy rushes in and looks over their shoulders to see Sean.
WENDY’S POV: Outside Sean’s house, ALLYSON, another senior, not as pretty, but very put together, sits in her convertible.  23 24 25 26 11/4/05 17. INT. BERGMAN HOUSE: WENDY’S ROOM - NIGHT 23
No shit.
Allyson? What does she want?
And a second later, they get their answer. Sean runs out of the house and gets in the car. INT. BERGMAN HOUSE: WENDY’S ROOM - NIGHT 25
No.
Apparently so.
(trying to remain aloof) That was fast.
That poor boy. He has no idea what he’s getting himself into. The girls watch the car pull away, past a Brown Sedan that is gently rocking.
(changing the subject) That car has been there every night this week. A foot sticks out of the passenger window. The girls laugh. Billie goes back to the bed, but Wendy keeps looking out the window.

Are we getting ready or what? INT. BERGMAN HOUSE: WENDY’S BATHROOM - NIGHT 26 Later that night, the three girls are in Wendy’s bathroom.  27 11/4/05 18. They have done their makeup and hair for a Saturday night, not too slutty, not too conservative. They look average, all-American, Midwestern. The girls look into the mirror into each other’s eyes smiling. N.E.R.D.’s song “Truth or Dare” starts playing. The SOUND OF A LOUD PARTY.
(yelling to be heard) They are complete magno-sluts.

Music continues. LOOKING AROUND THE ROOM, we see that everyone is treated to television sets running non-stop porn. Everyone drinks. Bong hits in the corner. In the background, girls disappear with guys into a variety of rooms. Basically, an average teen party. Sean stands with Allyson. RYAN (a girl, also a senior) is sitting on a kitchen counter nearby but out of earshot, with her boyfriend, AARON who is strumming a guitar. Alex, another senior, hands out beers to Sean and Allyson.

I mean, I understand why the guys do it but the girls? It is total depravity. THE DOOR THAT SEAN IS LEANING ON OPENS, and a sexy girl comes out of the bedroom, wiping her mouth. Sean lets her pass, and she looks at him, smiling seductively. A moment later a guy comes out, buttoning his pants.
(pointing) You should ask Ryan and Aaron. They got out.
(laughing) Got out? What, it’s a cult?
(serious) I guess. I mean, I don’t know what else you would call it. Don’t you have to kill yourself to be in a cult?  11/4/05 19.
And they all have sex with each other?
It’s pathetic, I know. Sean looks around at all the sex and drinking going on at this party.
So, why is what you’re doing different than what they’re doing?
(defensive) It just is. See, we invite them every week and they never show. Obviously they think they’re better than us. Allyson notices something across the room.

Oh my god! They put in a pole? That is so cool. Allyson goes towards the stripper pole someone has installed in the rec room. ALLYSON (CONT’D) I wanna turn! Sean moves through the party, heading for the kitchen where he last saw Ryan. Two guys play Playstation in one room, while a girl gives another guy a lap dance, a blank stare on her face. Sean walks by TWO TANK-TOP GIRLS going to the bathroom wearing almost identical tank-tops.
Are you going to Brian’s thing tomorrow night?
Yeah. I just wish it wasn’t a BJ party.
Seriously. They should hand out bibs. Sean looks at Ryan.  28 11/4/05 20.
Later on, Sean holds two beers as Ryan fixes her shoe, shaking a pebble out of it. She stumbles a little, then gets the shoe back on.
I’m not used to these. Aaron likes them.
Your boyfriend? She shrugs, as if to say, “what can you do”. SEAN (CONT’D) So you know Wendy?
Don’t. Really.
I just want to-- she’s my next door neighbor, you know?

Yeah. There’s a pause as Ryan and Sean watch a bunch of girls playing spin the bottle for a group of very rowdy guys. RYAN (CONT’D) Look, we just had an... arrangement, the eight of us. And when Aaron and I didn’t want to be with them anymore, we stopped. It’s not like I had to be de-programmed. Everyone wants it to be this big deal.
So it’s more like a club?
No!
What is it then? Ryan can’t really answer. The girls playing spin the bottle kiss and everyone cheers. SEAN (CONT’D) I can’t talk to her?  29 11/4/05 21.
No. I mean, you might be able to talk to her, and maybe hang out at school. You should join Student Council. we’re, I mean they’re all on it. I’m not anymore.
Seriously?
Yeah. What, you figured we hung out and smoked crack?
No. I don’t know.

Amnesty, and Model Congress and the Green Party. Last year we worked on two local campaigns. Sean looks shocked. RYAN (CONT’D) (kind of annoyed) Yeah, good students who have sex. It happens. They watch another group of girls kiss in the spin the bottle game and then get doused with beer. RYAN (CONT’D) I gotta find Aaron. She leaves Sean alone. He sees the SEXY GIRL WHO CAME OUT OF THE ROOM. She smiles at him and reaches out. He smiles shyly but lets her lead him back inside to a bedroom. As they enter, Tank-Top Girls look on.

What is she going for, a world’s record? They laugh. INT. ROBERT’S HOUSE: LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 29 In contrast to the party, Robert’s house is quiet, and serene. Marathon Man plays on the television. Our six are sitting on the floor of Robert’s sunken living room, despite the overstuffed and expensive furniture. They are all draped over each other, so that you can’t tell whose legs are whose.  11/4/05 22. During the scene they throw individually wrapped condoms at each other, winging them hard, like frisbees. In front of them are six SHOE BOXES, each one with a name on it, one for each of them.
I would definitely want to torture Jack Black.
He’s funny!
He’s perfect torture material. He thinks he’s funny, so he’d be laughing. Until he cried. Why, who would you torture?
Lindsay Lohan. Lindsay Lohan. They laugh.
Obvious and tired. Something original. Billie sticks out her tongue.
(to Ann, of the boxes) You putting in or taking out?
Taking out.
You always take out. I’m surprised that box isn’t empty.
I’d torture Eminem. Without a doubt.
Why?

He’s so smug, ya know. And he thinks he’s black. So I would tie him up and shock him with stuff. You know, feet in a tub of water. Ann reaches into her box and pulls out a small black marble.  11/4/05 23.
The marble that I stole in fifth grade.
Why?
Because I’m going to give it back. Bad karma.
Like you know anything about karma. You should be worried about the yin and yang of that box.
Besides, I stole that marble. You just held onto it for me. Ann sticks her tongue out at Price.
You stole that marble because someone- -
-- Lisa Nishi--
Right, Lisa Nishi, told you that you could sit with her if you did.
I don’t remember that.
I do. She let you sit with her and her little fifth grade posse for one second because you only stole one marble.
Who the hell plays with marbles anyway? It’s so dipshitty 1957. Price shrugs.
I’d torture at least one Olsen.
(clearly one of her faves)  11/4/05 24.
I would. She would be so spunky and then she'd break...it would be totally delicious. (to Ann) Why? wWho’d you torture?
I dunno. That Harry Potter kid probably.
Wendy? It’s your turn.
Yeah. In. Putting in.
Thank god. I’m sick of everyone taking stuff out. First you put it in the box and cry about whatever dumbass memory it stands for. And then you fish it out, saying you want it back.
Crying?
You know what I mean.
(picking up Price’s box) Yeah, and how many things are left in Senorita Price’s? Jonah fakes crying as he and Robert dip into the box.
Ohhh, this is the black nail polish I wore when I wanted to be Goth.
Screw you.
I can do whatever I want. It’s my box.
Yes baby, it is.
What’s going in?  11/4/05 25. Wendy holds up her “Hoochie” necklace, that the freshmen pointed out earlier.
That was a gift.
You’re always saying you don’t want us to apologize. Well, I don’t want us to bea joke. It’s not funny. Everyone thinks about that for a second.
I’m funny.
You’re freaking hysterical.
(still hung up on the game) You know the torturing? Well, what would we torture them for?
To torture them.
Usually there’s a...end result. Like information or because you need to send a message to the other side. Robert starts laughing.
The other side? There isn’t another side. We’re just saying -- if we were gonna break someone’s will, who would it be?
Um. I dunno. Do they have to be alive?
No. You’re not gonna do it anyway, so no. Anyone.
Either Abraham Lincoln or me at twelve years old.
Fuck. That is such a good answer  11/4/05 26. Billie takes stock of the boxes. JONAH (CONT’D) (re. the boxes) I went. We all went. Robert stands up and stretches.
You guys gonna help clean up?
You have a fucking maid.
Who reports back to my dad. Come on. Price, Jonah and Robert go out to start cleaning, Wendy and Ann start cleaning halfheartedly the area around them, what they can reach.
Price got really cute this summer. Billie lays back, her head in Ann’s lap.
We have to stop using that word, “cute.” Bunnies are cute. Men are sexy.
These aren’t men.
They will be. She rolls over so she is looking at Wendy.
They’11 be our men. Ten years from now they’1l be the strongest, smartest men anyone knows. And they’1l be ours.
In ten years, I’m not gonna be here.
Why not? After all you invested? This is almost 17 years of training, of learning. You want to start from scratch?  11/4/05 27.
(upset) You’re kidding right? What, we’re gonna buy a big house in Utah?

(nonplussed) You’1l see. We’re all going to college together. And then get houses next door As if to prove her point, Billie grabs Price by the knees as he walks by; he falls on the floor. Then she straddles him. He tries to get up.

(to Ann and Wendy) A little help, here? Instead the girls all sit on Price, and it turns into more of a wrestling match/tickling fight. Price is outnumbered so Robert and Jonah come to his “rescue.” Robert grabs Billie and Jonah grabs Wendy, leaving Ann on top of Price.
(teasing) Sorry, kids. It’s Saturday night and rules are rules. Without rules we would die.
(mocking her) That’s a little dramatic.

Billie is drama. Nonetheless they re-order, and not without some giggling. Now Robert is with Wendy, Price is with Billie, and Jonah is with Ann. The three couples start making out at various speeds, but each one is fully engaged with whomever they are with. As the camera pulls up and moves over the three couples they each end up on the floor, Robert on top of Wendy, he starts to take off his shirt; Billie straddles Price, his hands go underneath her pants; Ann holds Jonah’s hands down and slowly kisses him, moving down his chest Condoms litter the floor. We hold above them.  30 31 11/4/05 28. EXT. ROBERT’S HOUSE: ENTRANCE - NIGHT 30 Billie and Wendy sit on the front steps of Robert’s house. Wendy has her head in Billie’s lap, and they share a bottle of beer. Billie is looking at Wendy’s hair.
You have, like, sixteen split ends.
Shut up. They sit in silence, looking out on the suburban street everyone asleep, the gray hazy light of pre-dawn.
When we get to college--
Shhh. This is the best time. This is the time I don’t think about things like college. Just-- Wendy gets it, and they return to the silence.
(looking at her watch) It’s Sunday.
Yeah, you’re a freaking genius. Shut up we’re supposed to be having quiet Zen time. Billie thwacks Wendy lightly, and the girls giggle, and return to silence.
As in the beginning, the video of girls, this time just after a football game outside a local Denny’s. This GIRL looks down the whole time, she’s distracted as she text messages someone.

Why should guys have all the fun? TI mean, if I have to lay there anyway, at least I could be having fun, right?  32 33 11/4/05 29. She gets distracted by her text messages, and wanders away. TEEN GIRL #6 walks up and fixes her hair, then fishes a condom out of her back pocket
I’m like a boyscout --
(yelling)
(she flips them off) I’m prepared. I don’t wanna have to have a baby at the prom. That’s just ghetto. She looks at the condom, and then puts it back in her pocket. She smiles, knowingly.
Bergman & Mayer homes seen from overhead. It’s Monday morning, German-engineered cars are being driven to various workplaces.

Wendy comes into the kitchen. Wearing low-slung jeans and a sweater, she looks relatively tame. Wendy grabs some orange juice. ABBY BERGMAN (40’s, dresses mostly in caftans and wears a lot of ethnic jewelry) drinks coffee.
I would kill for your body. Wendy kisses her mom on the cheek
The best thing I can tell you is don’t get pregnant. I’d have a flat stomach today if I had stayed a person and not become a mom.
Mommm.
See? Nathan comes into the kitchen in his baggy jeans and long T-shirt, he’s half asleep.  34 11/4/05 30.
(opening the refrigerator) Nobody ate the coffee cake I made?
I can’t eat that stuff. Abby doesn’t say anything. Nathan takes a piece for himself, eats it quickly and washes it down with milk from the container.
Now can we go?
I gotta get my bag. Nathan leaves Abby and Wendy alone for a moment. A pause. ensemble.
You ready for your college interviews?
You worried I won’t clean up okay? That I’1l embarrass you?
(cowed) It’s just a question. Wendy reaches over and fingers her mother’s
(earnest) Mom, honestly. You could do so much better. Nathan and Wendy leave, Abby sits alone in the kitchen for a moment, her shoulders sagging.
Wendy and Nathan get into Wendy’s car; she sits for a moment, staring at the Mayer house.
